item.description:
"The Pawtucket Red Sox are going to the Governors Cup Finals for the first time since 2003 on the strength of a 7-1 win over Scranton on Saturday night in Rochester."

http://www.milb.com/news/article.jsp?ymd=20120908&content_id=38123128&vkey=news_t533&fext=.jsp&sid=t533

 

The PawSox are wild card winners!  They also have the highest batting average of the remaining teams, so they should be tough competition for the Governors Cup.  They will take on the Charlotte Knights in Game One of the series this Tuesday.  And, since this is their first time in the finals in 9 years, it should be a very exciting game!

  • Game time is 7:05pm.
  • We'll meet at 6:45pm at the statue of Paws in front of the stadium.
  • We'll each be buying our own ticket at the stadium.
  • Prices are the same as regular season tickets. ($11 box seats, $7 General Admission.)
  • There is no rain in the forecast, but it will be a chilly fall-like evening.  Perfect for playoff baseball!

So, bring your friends and your foam fingers, and let's cheer on our hometown team!
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the statue of Paws (the bear mascot) at 6:45
item.name: PawSox Playoff Finals Game!
